alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:50AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Norton, northeastern Rawlins, northeastern Sheridan, Decatur, northwestern Graham, southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 250 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Ludell to 9 miles northwest of Selden to 4 miles southwest of Lenora. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lenora around 300 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Edmond and Dresden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
